result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Joshua Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Joshua Brown appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for James Joshua Brown.  
Attorney Erika Strebel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Competency Review Hearing.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report/
 Court review the examiner's report with the parties.
Defendant is more likely than not to become competent within the permissible timeframe 
Defendant remains mute. Court ordered case adjourned for an additional review hearing. 
 Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Court in receipt and receive Letter from Dr collins and ordered matter to be rescheduled.
Parties contacted via email and new date selected.  Doctor's report hearing September 16, 2022 at 10:30am.
Competency Evaluation Extension Letter
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed and filed.
Proposed order signed and filed.
Proposed Order Signed and filed.

Defendant James Joshua Brown in court via zoom with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent. Defendant in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Competency Hearing.  Parties review report and do not contest  Doctors Report.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame with credit for 154 days time served.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Review Hearing.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James Joshua Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel unable to appear due to jury trial schedule.  This matter is adjourned to 6/13/22 at 9:00 in br 45.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reviewed the Dr. Report.   State does not challenge Dr. Collins report.  Defense does not challenge Dr. Collins report.  The Defendant DOES challenge the Dr. Report.   Deputy Harrell attempted to have defendant appear in court via zoom, defendant refused to appear.  Court ordered this matter adjourned for competency hearing in Br 45.  Defendant to appear via zoom.  Clerk contacted Forensic Unit for hearing date.  Case is adjourned for Competency Hearing.  mn  Competency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Proposed "Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services"

Defendant James Joshua Brown in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Joshua Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, and ordered defendant examined by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant James Joshua Brown not in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens located at 2826 N Martin Luther King Jr Drive, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant James Joshua Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant James Joshua Brown in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Joshua Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
